block.p: LEAD: Charges that the Rite Aid Corporation and its president bribed a member of the Ohio Board of Pharmacy will be heard in a trial set to begin April 16, officials of Cuyahoga County Common Pleas Court have said. Judge Lillian J. Greene had previously set a tentative trial date of Jan. 15. Rite Aid and its president, Martin Grass, have been charged with bribing Melvin L.

LEAD: Charges that the Rite Aid Corporation and its president bribed a member of the Ohio Board of Pharmacy will be heard in a trial set to begin April 16, officials of Cuyahoga County Common Pleas Court have said. Judge Lillian J. Greene had previously set a tentative trial date of Jan. 15. Rite Aid and its president, Martin Grass, have been charged with bribing Melvin L.

Charges that the Rite Aid Corporation and its president bribed a member of the Ohio Board of Pharmacy will be heard in a trial set to begin April 16, officials of Cuyahoga County Common Pleas Court have said. Judge Lillian J. Greene had previously set a tentative trial date of Jan. 15. Rite Aid and its president, Martin Grass, have been charged with bribing Melvin L. Wilczynski, a member of the Ohio board, to resign in an effort to gain influence on the Board. Both the company and Mr. Grass have pleaded not guilty.
